data.text:
Herman Groves Credits Position Writer Biographical Information Full Name Herman John Groves Birthdate September 21, 1927 Birthplace Baltimore, Maryland, United States Death Date December 5, 2010 (age 83) Death Place Laguna Woods, California, United States[1]

Herman Groves was a writer on Bewitched. He wrote four episodes for the series (1964-1966).

Biography[]

Herman John Groves was an American writer and producer for film and television. He was born on September 21, 1927, in Baltimore, Maryland. He was a Navy veteran.

Groves wrote scripts for favorite shows such as "Bewitched," "Fantasy Island," and "Walt Disney's Wonderful World of Color."

Groves passed away peacefully on December 5, 2010, with his family at his side in Laguna Woods, California. He was survived by two sons, four daughters, sixteen grandchildren, and three great-grandchildren.[2]

Episodes[]

A Bum Raps

Eye of the Beholder

A Vision of Sugar Plums (including repeat)
